p: Compound ( 2) was isolated as colorless needles; mp 239–241 °C. The molecular formula was deduced to be C 32H 48O 2 from EIMS ( m/z 468) suggesting the presence of an additional acetoxy group in comparison to 1, which was established by the IR absorption band at 1735 cm −1 for an ester group. The 1H and 13C-NMR spectral data of 2 were almost identical to that of 1 except for ring A. The major differences were the presence of signals corresponding to an acetyl group (δ H 2.04, s; δ C 171.06 and 21.35) attached to C-3 position in 2 instead of a hydroxyl group in 1. The downfield shift of H-3 proton, which appeared at δ 4.48 (dd, J.= 11.0, 5.1 Hz, H-3) in 2 compared with the corresponding proton in 1 (δ 3.20), confirmed the presence of the acetyl moiety. The large vicinal coupling constant (11.0 Hz) is consistent with an axial position for H-3 and an equatorial orientation for the acetate. From these data it was evident that compound 2 was the acetylated derivative of pseudo-taraxasterol 1. On the basis of the abovementioned data and through comparison with the literature [ 14], compound 2 was identified as pseudo-taraxaterol acetate.
